subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... Hi, with java you have to let the hotspot warm up, running the code several times to let the jvm analyze code. Run the benchmark for some seconds, than
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:
> FWIW I translated the Java into C++ and ran the same benchmark. Oddly
> enough, the variable name length definitely has a pronounced effect
> in C++. On a slow PC used as a test box, results looked like this:
>
> Java C++ -O1 C++ -O2
> short 13.4s 3.2s 4.1s
> long 12.0s 8.4s 7.2s
>
> memory use 12.4 MB 0.8 MB 0.8 MB
>

Hi,
with java you have to let the hotspot warm up, running the code several
times to let the jvm analyze code.
Run the benchmark for some seconds, than start to measure.

To have a smaller footprint try -Xms1m.

Bye


Lorenzo
